question: Sometimes at work, I go out to lunch with some co-workers.  Most of these times, I don't take my Novalog fast-acting insulin pen with me.  However, I inject myself shortly after the meal, when I get back to the office.  The max. amount of time I inject AFTER a meal is about 30 minutes.  Is this a bad idea or should I assume that it's better to be late than never?  I'm a 26 year old Type-1 diabetic by the way.Thanks   :)
title: Using fast-acting diabetes AFTER a meal?
